Description: Stucco wall fragment, with marks of pointed tool with a triangular head. Originally consisted of three layers of cement and lime plaster. The top layer has split off and is separate. Traces of the third layer, or something post-depositional, remain. This third layer is likely gypsum based.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'first temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: Dated 575BC - 560BC on the basis of architectural fragments from this phase of the Apollo temple (Koenigs 2007, 316-7).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AC.14) (Phase 3)
